CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lois Butler, 3654 Fairwood Street, Broadhead Manor, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: �Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?� answer reads: �Where I�m living the adults are doing their best. We have an all around program.  The youths are outside during all summer and there is a camping system for youths age eight to eleven.  I would say that the youth program is fairly good.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lois Butler, wearing floral head scarf, eyeglasses, and dark coat, holding paper bag, standing in front of sign that reads "improved Choice... Filler", store window with product display on right, including "Gillette" and "Keep Collar Points Down", man leaning against wall on the left
